page.title: 021086 DOMESDAY SURVEY
page.content: Hagley was first mentioned in writing in the{Domesday survey}of 1086,when it was known as Hageleia.Its lord was {Willhemus (Fitz Ansculfi),}whose sub-tenant was the local knight, Roger. The inhabitants mentioned were 5 villeins,10 bordars, and 1 priest. The next significant mention of Hagley comes in the{Lay Subsidy Roll of 1327.This survey of Haggeleye is not a complete list of all inhabitants, but 12 residents are mentioned, including Edmundo, lord of the manor. Hagley's{parish records}contain registers of baptisms, marriages, and burials dating back to 1538. From these details, some conclusions can be drawn about the nature of Hagley society in the late 16th and 17th centuries.
